Entries.default: This young man appears either to be composing or practicing a tune on his lute. He stops mid-strum, looking up at you with a friendly expression.
"Something I can do for you?"
"I had some questions."
[Lie] "Just came to listen to you play."
"Never mind."
"Ezzali Bardatto asked me to spy on you."
"I'm hardly one to judge, but... uh, I'm not sure you're getting the 'spy' part entirely right." He offers you a guileless smile.
[Leave] "Nothing for now."
"Oh, sure. What about?"
"Oh. Sorry to disappoint, then. I'm having an imp of a time with this piece." He offers you a sheepish grin.
"All right..." He looks puzzled.
"I'm trying to find a way to stop your houses from killing each other."
"Being direct gets more results."
"She seems to think you're in the know regarding some nefarious plot."
"Your family's been having trouble with the Bardattos, right?"
[Lie] "I hear you're the one to talk to about certain kinds of jobs."
"These sailors are generous with their pocket change!"
"If you are after some scenery, I suggest the far end of the bridge. It smells better when the wind blows in from the sea, of course."
"Ondra's nethers. S-something I can do for you?" He stares at your head with disbelief.
"Ah... please don't tell Martino."
"You a distant Bardatto cousin or something? I don't know how Ezzali think I can help, but ..." He trails off nervously.
"What? That doesn't make..." Zili's face blanches.
"And what is it you want to do with this information - side with Ezzali?"
"She wants me to figure out what the Valera family is planning. That's all."
"Let's make this quick. Tell me what the Valera family is planning and I'll let you live."
[Grab his wrist.] "Care to find out if broken fingers improve your music?"
"I'm trying to prevent this feud from escalating. I thought you would want the same."
"I'm not taking any sides in this conflict."
"Leave me alone, will you?"
"Just don't hurt Persa, okay?"
"Ugh, it was Persa, wasn't it? Is she recruiting again?" Zili scowls.
"You can tell her I'm not getting involved in whatever she's up to!"
"Guess that means you've spent at least an hour or two in town." Zili sighs.
"You're going to have to if you keep meddling with family affairs."
"Of course I do, I just..." Zili scratches his cheek and glances over his shoulder.
"I caught cousin Persa running her mouth off about the job Belda got her involved in."
"We aren't thieves and killers, you know. No matter what Ezzali says."
"Of course not - why get your principles involved when it isn't your family? You're just looking out for yourself."
"Like I said, Persa's down in the Gullet."
"Persa's been spending time in the Gullet, in the tavern down there. Maybe she could tell you more."
"No! Wait, just wait!" Zili cringes, twisting in your grip.
"Well, she's paying me. So she'll hear about it all right."
"I'll consider it."
"But before you go... Ezzali can't hear about this. I told Persa and all the rest of them not to make trouble. If the Huana guards don't get us, Ezzali will."
"I know that you're trying to get in the way, and that you have your reasons. Just... don't hurt her." Zili steps back wearing an uncertain frown.
"No promises."
Zili's eyes widen, and he takes a step back. But there's a stubborn defiance in his voice.
"I'll tell her, once I find her."
"So... you're NOT the one to talk to?"
"You've never sought revenge?"
"A blood feud doesn't seem like the kind of thing you can sit out."
"Smart. Better to stay out of what doesn't concern you."
"Atello still runs the family. Maybe you can get him and Ezzali talking? Not that anyone listens to me."
Zili opens his mouth to speak, then sags, his expression bleak.
"Go plot your mischief with Persa. She's got a room in the tavern down in the Gullet. Just leave me out of it."
"No! Whatever Persa has planned, it's not how we do things." Zili flushes with anger.
"Not like Martino does, no. My uncle works hard to prove we're not thieves or murderers."
"I fear that Persa's going to ruin that for us. She's in the thick of something too big for her."
"I had hoped to do just that, but it doesn't seem that my hopes have any bearing on the matter." His expression falls.
"Maybe. I don't know. I just don't have a mind for strategy." He balances his lute on his hip and sighs.
"Whatever Persa's cooking up, it's only going to make things worse."
"Persa?"
"I caught cousin Persa running her mouth off about the job Belda got her involved in."
"Why not just tell the guards?"
"Sorry, I guess you got a mouthful, huh? I really ought to get back to my lute."
"Persa's family. That means something, even if I think she's wrong at best, an idiot at worst."
"Every family has its nemesis."
"I ought to be used to it by now, but I keep thinking of ways we can make peace with the Bardattos." He sighs and carelessly plucks a string of his lute.
Zili blinks at you and opens his mouth to speak, hesitating. He raises a finger in the air.
"I've seen my share of family disputes that ended in tragedy."
"Huh. If you speak from a place of experience, I can respect that."
"And she's up to what again?"
"Look... you seem like a nice person, but I'm just here to practice my lute in peace."
"I'm preventing the reprisal that will inevitably hit your family when the Bardattos realize what happened."

"Even if we crippled the Bardattos, someone would scrounge together the coin for an assassin. And this would just... keep going."

Zili sighs and rubs his brow.
"Sounds like you know what's right for the family."
"Yes! And what's right is that we stay out of... out of Bardatto business."
"I'm trying to clear some Rauataian sailors out of the tavern. Word is they like music."

"Sounds like a Martino plan to me. Do I have the right of it?" 

Zili flashes a sheepish grin, and looks off in the direction of the Valera estate.

"I could keep these sailors of yours... diverted? Feel free to send them my way.

"And so- no bloodshed."

He smiles hopefully.
"This is not how I would have chosen to spy on someone."
"A heist on the Bardatto estate, I think. I came out here to keep my distance from all that."
"I may not approve of my family's methods, but I'm not about to sabotage them, either."
"Which is the opposite of what we're about to do, isn't it?" Zili sighs and shakes his head.
"Have things gotten any better with the Valeras?"
"Martino was always a... tough cousin. Now he's insufferable." Zili raps his lute, producing a hollow sound.
"Martino's miserable without all the friction." Zili tickles the strings of his lute and grins.
"Feeling proud to be a Valera for once."
"Martino says we won. I don't feel like a winner."
"Poor uncle Atello."
"But our fleet is strong? I only hear secondhand." Zili shrugs and plucks a harmonious note.
"Everyone knows he gutted the Bardatto house. Bad form in this neighborhood." He plucks a hard note.
"And now Ezzali's business partners pulled up stakes. We're hardly any better off than before."
"Ah, madiccho! How does it go...?"
"Ah- apologies, lord, if I intrude upon your peace. Inspiration eludes me still."
Entries.female: "Ah- apologies, lady, if I intrude upon your peace. Inspiration eludes me still."

Entries.default: "Just this once I'll make an exception."
"Never solve with violence what you can with music, I say."
"There are certainly worse ways to pass one's time." He nods approvingly.
"Right shame there ain't more of your type quicker to the fiddle than the flail and flog."
Sighing, Maia pinches the bridge of her nose and shakes her head.

"Wonder what the strung up lads and lasses of the Jubilant Rapscallion would be having to say bout that."

Serafen scowls from above crossed arms.
"Persa's been spending time in the Gullet, in the tavern down there. Maybe she could tell you more."
